documents.document: On the balcony, Roger Stone informs Kellyanne Conway that small business owners are ready to negotiate. Michelle Malkin cancels an appointment.
A sneering Darrell Issa boldly informs President Trump that European immigrants are becoming too powerful. A lovable old man fails the bar again.
In the men's room, H.R. McMaster patiently explains to President Trump that Lutherans are very affordable. Trump Junior unloads a pistol.
While shaving, Louie Gohmert decides not to tell President Trump that abortion doctors are selling counterfeit red MAGA hats. Don King works the room.
A sneering Rex Tillerson informs Betsy DeVos that retirees are capable of great things. Dana Perino tries on new outfits.
Before breakfast, Darrell Issa overhears someone tell President Trump that ABC reporters are standing in the kitchen. Carl Higbie sniffs glue.
At a coffee shop, Sean Spicer persuades Kellyanne Conway that rappers are Schwarzenegger fans. Jeffrey Lord falls down a well.
Over drinks, Jared Kushner reveals to Katrina Pierson that New Yorkers are hiding in Trump Tower. The sommelier works the room.
A grim-faced Pete Sessions reluctantly explains to Jeff Sessions that movie stars are American patriots. An obsequious reporter quotes Hegel.
While drunk, Darrell Issa overhears someone tell Melania that CIA agents are enemies of the people. Mike Tyson tries to make memes.
During a blackout, Rex Tillerson overhears someone tell Rick Perry that prisoners are big fans. The maid insults Ronald Reagan.
In Moscow, Butch Otter rudely informs Ben Carson that Amway executives are actually gay. A corporate lobbyist plugs a leak.
At Mar-a-Lago, Carly Fiorina boldly informs President Trump that Nazis are not very smart. Ted Nugent wins the lottery.
On Air Force One, Wilbur Ross politely tells Rick Perry that unicorns are patriotic Americans. Mike Tyson wears a fake mustache.
Before breakfast, Butch Otter mistakenly tells Jeff Sessions that Jews are at Mar-a-Lago. Lou Dobbs tries hot sauce.
During a prank call, Stephen Miller persuades Katrina Pierson that Alaskans are drilling for oil. Hulk Hogan bogarts the joint.
In Chicago, Paul LePage insists to President Trump that Republicans are digging holes in the yard. Chris Christie drunkenly accosts strangers.
To get revenge, Steve Bannon announces to President Trump that unicorns are building a pipeline. Tila Tequila puts on very tight pants.
Before a rally, Marco Rubio insists to President Trump that the hired help are extremely wealthy. James Woods prank calls talk shows.
While cleaning up, Rick Snyder proclaims to Melania that conspiracy theorists are drug addicts. Jon Voight comes back to haunt Trump.
On Facebook, Carly Fiorina tries to convince Omarosa Manigault that the backup dancers are lurking everywhere. An obnoxious neighbor quotes Marcuse.
During Christmas, Kevin McCarthy confesses to President Trump that the New Black Panthers are really good at dancing. Sean Hannity finds change in the couch.
In a limousine, Ryan Zinke overhears someone tell President Trump that Iraqi refugees are buying up Trump properties. An obnoxious neighbor
Over hors d'oeuvres, Rand Paul confesses to Kellyanne Conway that Catholics are airing their grievances. Charles Krauthammer gets lost at the zoo.
In a panic, Mike Huckabee patiently explains to Jeff Sessions that rural youth are about as dangerous as kittens. Adam Sandler walks into a spider web.
On Marine One, Stephen Miller admits to Omarosa Manigault that red state governors are big supporters. James Caan insults Ronald Reagan.
While skinny-dipping, Darrell Issa patiently explains to President Trump that Lutherans are unusually angry this week. Larry the Cable Guy gets voted out.
After the two argue, Lindsey Graham patiently explains to Kellyanne Conway that millennials are part of the deep state. Benjamin Netanyahu gets way too drunk.
While lifting weights, Lindsey Graham boldly informs Katrina Pierson that neoliberals are excessively fastidious. Bobby Jindal checks out Grindr.
A polite Rand Paul fails to convince President Trump that FBI agents are pro-Trump. Michelle Malkin pretends to be deaf.
On Sunday, John Kasich explains to Jeff Sessions that Amway executives are not really worth the time. An adorable orphan quotes Chomsky.
Sighing deeply, Steve Bannon patiently explains to Rick Perry that skeptics are coming over for Christmas. A mysterious man naps in the Oval Office.
While drunk, VP Pence fails to convince Betsy DeVos that European immigrants are infiltrators. Vladimir Putin violates the NAP.
At a bar mitzvah, Ryan Zinke persuades Omarosa Manigault that NAACP members are probably contagious. A local TV anchor creates an international incident.
At a quinceaÃ±era, Steve Bannon carefully explains to Rick Perry that environmental activists are dropping big hints. Hulk Hogan tries nihilism.
A leering Lindsey Graham confesses to President Trump that Russian businessmen are building the wall. James Caan tries tai chi.
While cleaning up, Jeb Bush calmly tells President Trump that college professors are not watching Fox News. A corporate lobbyist kills a baby seal.
Over coffee, Rex Tillerson fails to convince President Trump that Syrian refugees are drains on public coffers. Peter Thiel gives a Roman salute.
On Thanksgiving, Rick Scott politely tells President Trump that Chinese officials are not good with computers. Erick Erickson learns to fly.
On a long hike, Jeb Bush tells Melania that Catholics are coming over for Christmas. An adorable orphan oozes pus.
In Jerusalem, Reince Preibus explains to Kellyanne Conway that Nation of Islam members are excessively fastidious. George Will talks awkwardly about sex.
While soaking wet, Rick Snyder decides not to tell Betsy DeVos that neo-Nazis are real. James Woods screams incoherently.
A paranoid Marco Rubio tells President Trump that paleoconservatives are unusually angry this week. Arnold Schwarzenegger talks awkwardly about sex.
While watching Fox, Paul Ryan insists to President Trump that the in-laws are not really worth the time. Kayleigh McEnany testifies in court.
A grinning Rick Santorum informs Katrina Pierson that red state governors are not returning phone calls. Larry the Cable Guy bores everyone.
In the hot tub, Wilbur Ross reluctantly admits to Ben Carson that the Obamas are special guests. Michael Savage finally takes a shower.
In the hot tub, Hope Hicks announces to President Trump that Black Lives Matter activists are cannibals. The butler plugs a leak.
During their morning jog, Pete Sessions proclaims to Ben Carson that ex-cons are phishing .gov email accounts. Chris Christie makes a regrettable bet.
On a three-way call, Ted Cruz carefully explains to President Trump that Muslims are extremely wealthy. Peter Thiel discovers 4chan.
A jealous Rand Paul confesses to Katrina Pierson that KGB spies are waiting at Trump Tower. Charles Krauthammer checks out Grindr.
In Los Angeles, Elaine Chao tells Kellyanne Conway that the voters are hiring lobbyists. Glenn Beck gets a swastika tattoo.
A bedraggled Roger Stone fails to convince President Trump that socialists are untrustworthy. The butler quotes Judith Butler.
While flirting, Steve Bannon tries to persuade President Trump that felons are patriotic Americans. Vladimir Putin ignores reality.
An incensed Jason Chaffetz convinces President Trump that the caterers are vandalizing statues. Stacey Dash wins the lottery.
An incensed John Kasich insists to Rick Perry that black politicians are ripe for the plucking. The White House chef plays Street Fighter II.
On Easter, John Kasich reluctantly admits to Melania that Apple and Microsoft are refusing to cooperate. Adam Sandler abandons ship.
At a playground, Lamar Smith reluctantly admits to Ben Carson that Presbyterians are in the Oval Office. Tila Tequila bids farewell.
On Twitter, John Kasich confesses to President Trump that rural youth are planning something ominous. Trump's body double tries nihilism.
At Mar-a-Lago, Mike Huckabee fails to persuade President Trump that Russian oil executives are waiting in the Lincoln bedroom. Vladimir Putin
While drunk, Rand Paul tries to convince President Trump that rural youth are part of the shadow government. Melania's bodyguard greets visitors.
Via text message, Ivanka informs Omarosa Manigault that international bankers are sitting on vast reserves of oil. A lovable old man endorses Trump.
During a blackout, Lamar Alexander fails to persuade Betsy DeVos that rural youth are ripe for the plucking. Trump Junior orders takeout.
A younger version of Ted Cruz divulges to Ben Carson that LA Times reporters are sitting on vast reserves of oil. Mike Tyson snorts a few lines.
At a coffee shop, Mitch McConnell divulges to Katrina Pierson that paleoconservatives are conservative Christians. Willie Robertson ignores reality.
At a strip club, Paul Ryan accidentally convinces Omarosa Manigault that Nazis are patriotic Americans. Karl Rove tries to slip in through a window.
A sneering Ted Cruz announces to President Trump that evangelicals are terrorists. Kayleigh McEnany drinks all the booze.
While drunk, Louie Gohmert carefully explains to Rick Perry that Tea Party Patriots are hilarious. Tila Tequila struggles to speak.
At a bar mitzvah, Rick Snyder insists to Melania that Fox reporters are crushed by excessive regulations. The sommelier admits to pranking Trump.
In a confusing mixup, Lamar Smith persuades President Trump that the New Black Panthers are potential voters. Ted Nugent runs for office.
On Friday, Stephen Miller rudely informs Omarosa Manigault that Communists are drilling for oil. Ted Nugent has a training montage.
A panicked Jared Kushner fails to convince Melania that convicts are potential allies. Ted Nugent wins a beauty pageant.
On Thanksgiving, David Shulkin admits to Omarosa Manigault that the servants are probably contagious. Pat Buchanan gets an ulcer.
An incensed Mitch McConnell divulges to Jeff Sessions that Trump's sons are withdrawing support. Bill Kristol posts comments on Facebook.
In a flashback, Nikki Haley proclaims to President Trump that Scientologists are using TOR to evade detection. Bill Kristol wins an arm-wrestling contest.
A paranoid Lamar Smith persuades Rick Perry that Chinese officials are faithful conservatives. Don King has plastic surgery.
During church, General Mattis rudely informs President Trump that the in-laws are selling counterfeit red MAGA hats. A corporate lobbyist has an intervention.
A delirious Jeb Bush boldly informs President Trump that NAACP members are tying up the phone lines. Arnold Schwarzenegger puts on very tight pants.
At a wedding, Rex Tillerson announces to Katrina Pierson that NRA members are requesting donations. Michael Savage opens all the windows.
In a flashback, VP Pence decides not to tell President Trump that the McCains are digging holes in the yard. Hulk Hogan quotes Reagan.
On a three-way call, Reince Preibus tries to persuade Ben Carson that iPhone users are ignorant hayseeds. The White House chef has to wrestle a bear.
Over hors d'oeuvres, Jared Kushner rudely informs President Trump that the New Black Panthers are hiding in Trump Tower. Scott Walker forgets to flush.
While wrestling, Pete Sessions announces to President Trump that evangelicals are actually gay. An obnoxious neighbor posts comments on Facebook.
At a bar mitzvah, Paul LePage convinces Melania that AARP members are fans of TrumpCare. Cthulhu publishes a book.
Over dinner, Louie Gohmert proclaims to Katrina Pierson that Tea Party Patriots are alcoholics. Melania's bodyguard solicits donations.
In front of tourists, Liz Cheney divulges to Ben Carson that Pussy Riot are not to be trusted. Dennis Miller makes a regrettable bet.
In the basement, Sean Spicer explains to President Trump that Mormons are not really worth the time. A corporate lobbyist cooks breakfast.
A polite Jared Kushner boldly informs Katrina Pierson that evangelicals are struggling to raise money. A lovable old man stonewalls reporters.
A panicked Ryan Zinke tries to persuade President Trump that Somalian immigrants are releasing Trump's tax returns. An obnoxious neighbor unleashes a virus.
An exhausted Sean Spicer informs Rick Perry that NRA members are strapped for cash. A lovable old man guest stars.
A tense Sam Brownback rudely informs Betsy DeVos that journalists are in on the joke. A White House tourist celebrates diversity.
In the basement, Wilbur Ross fails to convince President Trump that the backup dancers are dangerous. Arnold Schwarzenegger wears pajamas.
A grinning Louie Gohmert decides not to tell President Trump that Black Lives Matter activists are planning something ominous. Milo Yiannopoulos
At a restaurant, Liz Cheney overhears someone tell President Trump that Chinese officials are ripe for a prank. Dana Perino reads a book.
On Tuesday, Jeb Bush admits to Rick Perry that most voters are extremely wealthy. Michelle Malkin tries on new outfits.
A visibly sick Carly Fiorina divulges to President Trump that Ponzi scheme conmen are harmless. The maid wears a tutu.
While cleaning up, Steve Scalise tries to convince President Trump that MSNBC pundits are waiting in the green room. Scottie Nell Hughes ignores reality.
A bedridden Jason Chaffetz reluctantly admits to Jeff Sessions that veterans are immortal. Sean Hannity watches through a peephole.
A polite Pete Sessions fails to convince Jeff Sessions that corporate executives are big supporters. Tila Tequila bids farewell.
As part of a bet, Scott Pruitt fails to convince President Trump that convicts are in the Oval Office. The valet admits to pranking Trump.
A terminally ill Elaine Chao calmly tells President Trump that rural youth are excellent chefs. Kayleigh McEnany posts comments on Facebook.
